job_details.Functieomschrijving:
As Windows System Engineer in Accenture Technology - Cloud First, you will play a pivotal role in driving our customers' cloud initiatives, leveraging Microsoft's Azure platform to design, build, migrate, and optimize scalable cloud solutions. Your expertise will be crucial in advancing our customers' cloud adoption strategies, ensuring security and optimizing their infrastructure through effective use of Azure's toolset and frameworks. Join our team and contribute to shaping the future of our customers' cloud infrastructure, leveraging your expertise in Azure to drive innovation and excellence.
     * People You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, system administrators, and project managers, to ensure seamless integration and operation of cloud services for our customers. Your ability to communicate effectively and mentor junior team members will be essential in fostering a collaborative and efficient working environment.
     * Process You will lead the implementation of the Cloud Adoption Framework for our customers, ensuring their processes align with best practices for cloud governance, security, and compliance. Your role will involve refining and enhancing our customers' DevOps processes, facilitating continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines, and automating infrastructure management using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Bicep or Terraform.
     * Technology Your in-depth understanding of cloud architecture and Azure's capabilities will be instrumental in designing, building, migrating, and optimizing workloads for robust landing zones and other cloud infrastructure components for our customers. You will utilize Azure DevOps tools and services to streamline project workflows and ensure the reliability and scalability of our customers' cloud environments.
     * Task Starting in a dedicated Windows team. This team supports our customers on a daily basis. However, it doesn't stop at supporting, we are constantly striving to optimize and improve these environments. To make this easier, we like to automate with, for example, ARM templates, Ansible, PowerShell and Bash. In this team, our defining characteristic is the exceptional level of ownership we demonstrate. We work closely with other client teams and with the consulting team to deliver great results. It will be your job to implement and perfect complex IT environments for a long time. After implementation, you will monitor them, keep them running and continuously improve. You always see opportunities to improve it. If this also applies to you and you like to know everything about new technologies and apply this directly to the projects of our customers, read on.

   With all our roles, there is some in-person time for collaboration, learning and building relationships with clients, peers, leaders, and communities. As an employer, we will be as flexible as possible to support your specific work/life needs.
job_details.full_text:
Windows System Engineer

As Windows System Engineer in Accenture Technology - Cloud First, you will play a pivotal role in driving our customers' cloud initiatives, leveraging Microsoft's Azure platform to design, build, migrate, and optimize scalable cloud solutions. Your expertise will be crucial in advancing our customers' cloud adoption strategies, ensuring security and optimizing their infrastructure through effective use of Azure's toolset and frameworks. Join our team and contribute to shaping the future of our customers' cloud infrastructure, leveraging your expertise in Azure to drive innovation and excellence.
     * People You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, system administrators, and project managers, to ensure seamless integration and operation of cloud services for our customers. Your ability to communicate effectively and mentor junior team members will be essential in fostering a collaborative and efficient working environment.
     * Process You will lead the implementation of the Cloud Adoption Framework for our customers, ensuring their processes align with best practices for cloud governance, security, and compliance. Your role will involve refining and enhancing our customers' DevOps processes, facilitating continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines, and automating infrastructure management using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Bicep or Terraform.
     * Technology Your in-depth understanding of cloud architecture and Azure's capabilities will be instrumental in designing, building, migrating, and optimizing workloads for robust landing zones and other cloud infrastructure components for our customers. You will utilize Azure DevOps tools and services to streamline project workflows and ensure the reliability and scalability of our customers' cloud environments.
     * Task Starting in a dedicated Windows team. This team supports our customers on a daily basis. However, it doesn't stop at supporting, we are constantly striving to optimize and improve these environments. To make this easier, we like to automate with, for example, ARM templates, Ansible, PowerShell and Bash. In this team, our defining characteristic is the exceptional level of ownership we demonstrate. We work closely with other client teams and with the consulting team to deliver great results. It will be your job to implement and perfect complex IT environments for a long time. After implementation, you will monitor them, keep them running and continuously improve. You always see opportunities to improve it. If this also applies to you and you like to know everything about new technologies and apply this directly to the projects of our customers, read on.

   With all our roles, there is some in-person time for collaboration, learning and building relationships with clients, peers, leaders, and communities. As an employer, we will be as flexible as possible to support your specific work/life needs.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on Windows System Engineering and cloud infrastructure management using Azure, including tasks like migration, optimization, security, and automation with tools like Bicep, Terraform, Ansible, PowerShell, and Bash. It emphasizes collaboration, process improvement, and ownership within a dedicated Windows team. While it mentions cloud and DevOps practices, it does not involve the core responsibilities or technologies associated with ML Engineering or GenAI Engineering, such as algorithm development, predictive modeling, LLMs, RAG, or fine-tuning. Therefore, it falls outside the scope of AI-specific roles and is classified as Ambiguous according to the provided coding book.

job_tasks.justification: The description mentions 'automating infrastructure management using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Bicep or Terraform' and 'automating with, for example, ARM templates, Ansible, PowerShell and Bash', which are development-related activities for infrastructure.
job_tasks.phrase: automating infrastructure management using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Bicep or Terraform

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'automating with, for example, ARM templates, Ansible, PowerShell and Bash' refers to scripting and automation tasks which fall under software development in the context of infrastructure.
job_tasks.phrase: automating with, for example, ARM templates, Ansible, PowerShell and Bash

job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'DevOps processes, facilitating continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines' directly relates to operations engineering and MLOps principles, even if not specifically for ML models.
job_tasks.phrase: DevOps processes, facilitating continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines

job_tasks.justification: The role involves 'driving our customers' cloud initiatives' and 'advancing our customers' cloud adoption strategies', indicating a need to understand business goals related to cloud adoption.
The phrase 'advancing our customers' cloud adoption strategies' shows a focus on understanding and supporting business objectives through technology.
job_tasks.phrase: advancing our customers' cloud adoption strategies

job_tasks.justification: The description states 'design, build, migrate, and optimize scalable cloud solutions', which involves building and engineering solutions.
job_tasks.phrase: design, build, migrate, and optimize scalable cloud solutions

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'designing, building, migrating, and optimizing workloads for robust landing zones and other cloud infrastructure components' points to software development and engineering activities in cloud environments.
job_tasks.phrase: designing, building, migrating, and optimizing workloads for robust landing zones and other cloud infrastructure components

job_tasks.justification: The job involves 'monitoring them, keep them running and continuously improve', which are core aspects of operations and maintenance in an IT environment.
job_tasks.phrase: monitor them, keep them running and continuously improve

job_tasks.justification: While not traditional ML modeling, the phrase 'implement and perfect complex IT environments for a long time' implies a deep, iterative process of building and refining systems, which can be seen as a form of system modeling or configuration.
job_tasks.phrase: implement and perfect complex IT environments for a long time

soft_skills.phrase: work closely with other client teams and with the consulting team
always see opportunities to improve it
know everything about new technologies and apply this directly
